speaker: Professor Martin
text: So, how’s the group project coming along?
ipa: soʊ, haʊz ðə ɡruːp ˈprɒdʒɛkt ˈkʌmɪŋ əˈlɒŋ?
stress: SO, HOW’S the GROUP PROJECT COMING ALONG?

speaker: Student Ava
text: Honestly, I’m a bit worried about the presentation part. One team member keeps arguing with others about the design choices.
ipa: ˈɒnɪstli, aɪm ə bɪt ˈwʌrid əˈbaʊt ðə ˌprɛzənˈteɪʃən pɑːrt. wʌn tiːm ˈmɛmbər kiːps ˈɑːɡjuːɪŋ wɪð ˈʌðərz əˈbaʊt ðə dɪˈzaɪn ˈʧɔɪsɪz.
stress: HONESTLY, I’M a BIT WORRIED about the PRESENTATION PART. ONE TEAM MEMBER KEEPS ARGUING with OTHERS about the DESIGN CHOICES.

speaker: Professor Martin
text: Group dynamics can be tricky. Have you tried talking to him directly?
ipa: ɡruːp daɪˈnæmɪks kæn bi ˈtrɪki. hæv ju traɪd ˈtɔːkɪŋ tu hɪm dəˈrɛktli?
stress: GROUP DYNAMICS can be TRICKY. HAVE YOU TRIED TALKING to HIM DIRECTLY?

speaker: Student Ava
text: Yes, I spoke to him yesterday and tried to explain the rationale for our choices, but he didn’t seem convinced.
ipa: jɛs, aɪ spoʊk tu hɪm ˈjɛstərdeɪ ənd traɪd tu ɪkˈspleɪn ðə ˌræʃəˈnæl fər aʊər ˈʧɔɪsɪz, bət hi ˈdɪdnt siːm kənˈvɪnst.
stress: YES, I SPOKE to HIM YESTERDAY and TRIED to EXPLAIN the RATIONALE for OUR CHOICES, but HE DIDN’T SEEM CONVINCED.

speaker: Professor Martin
text: Sometimes people just need time. Have you discussed the roles and responsibilities clearly?
ipa: ˈsʌmtaɪmz ˈpiːpəl dʒəst niːd taɪm. hæv ju dɪˈskʌst ðə roʊlz ənd rɪˌspɒnsəˈbɪlɪtiz ˈklɪrli?
stress: SOMETIMES PEOPLE just NEED TIME. HAVE YOU DISCUSSED the ROLES and RESPONSIBILITIES CLEARLY?

speaker: Student Ava
text: We did. We even divided the tasks among ourselves fairly, but he keeps complaining about having to do the visuals.
ipa: wi dɪd. wi ˈiːvən dɪˈvaɪdɪd ðə tæsks əˈmʌŋ aʊərˈsɛlvz ˈfɛrli, bət hi kiːps kəmˈpleɪnɪŋ əˈbaʊt ˈhævɪŋ tu du ðə ˈvɪʒuəlz.
stress: WE DID. We EVEN DIVIDED the TASKS among OURSELVES FAIRLY, but HE KEEPS COMPLAINING about HAVING to DO the VISUALS.

speaker: Professor Martin
text: Maybe he’s just not confident in that area. You could suggest switching his task with someone who’s more experienced.
ipa: ˈmeɪbi hiːz dʒəst nɒt ˈkɒnfɪdənt ɪn ðæt ˈɛəriə. ju kʊd səˈdʒɛst ˈswɪʧɪŋ hɪz tæsk wɪð ˈsʌmwʌn huːz mɔːr ɪkˈspɪəriənst.
stress: MAYBE HE’S just NOT CONFIDENT in THAT AREA. YOU COULD SUGGEST SWITCHING his TASK with SOMEONE who’s MORE EXPERIENCED.

speaker: Student Ava
text: That could work. Also, I wrote to the group chat about scheduling another meeting, but no one’s replied yet.
ipa: ðæt kʊd wɜːrk. ˈɔːlsoʊ, aɪ roʊt tu ðə ɡruːp ʧæt əˈbaʊt ˈʃɛdjuːlɪŋ əˈnʌðər ˈmiːtɪŋ, bət noʊ wʌnz rɪˈplaɪd jɛt.
stress: THAT COULD WORK. ALSO, I WROTE to the GROUP CHAT about SCHEDULING ANOTHER MEETING, but NO ONE’S REPLIED YET.

speaker: Professor Martin
text: Try reminding them politely. Sometimes people need a little push, especially when they’re under pressure.
ipa: traɪ rɪˈmaɪndɪŋ ðɛm pəˈlaɪtli. ˈsʌmtaɪmz ˈpiːpəl niːd ə ˈlɪtl pʊʃ, ɪˈspɛʃəli wɛn ðeər ˈʌndər ˈprɛʃər.
stress: TRY REMINDING them POLITELY. SOMETIMES PEOPLE NEED a LITTLE PUSH, ESPECIALLY when THEY’RE UNDER PRESSURE.

speaker: Student Ava
text: Yeah, you’re right. I guess I was just upset with the lack of communication.
ipa: jæ, jʊər raɪt. aɪ ɡɛs aɪ wəz dʒəst ʌpˈsɛt wɪð ðə læk əv kəˌmjuːnɪˈkeɪʃən.
stress: YEAH, YOU’RE RIGHT. I GUESS I WAS just UPSET with the LACK of COMMUNICATION.

speaker: Professor Martin
text: Totally understandable. Just keep focused on what you can control, and try to deal with conflicts constructively.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli ˌʌndərˈstændəbəl. dʒəst kiːp ˈfoʊkəst ɒn wɒt ju kæn kənˈtroʊl, ənd traɪ tu diːl wɪð ˈkɒnflɪkts kənˈstrʌktɪvli.
stress: TOTALLY UNDERSTANDABLE. JUST KEEP FOCUSED on WHAT YOU CAN CONTROL, and TRY to DEAL with CONFLICTS CONSTRUCTIVELY.

speaker: Student Ava
text: Thanks. I really appreciate your advice. It helps to talk to someone who understands group dynamics.
ipa: θæŋks. aɪ ˈrɪəli əˈpriːʃieɪt jʊər ədˈvaɪs. ɪt hɛlps tu tɔːk tu ˈsʌmwʌn huː ˌʌndərˈstændz ɡruːp daɪˈnæmɪks.
stress: THANKS. I REALLY APPRECIATE your ADVICE. It HELPS to TALK to SOMEONE who UNDERSTANDS GROUP DYNAMICS.
linking:
"appreciate your" → /əˈpriːʃieɪt jʊər/ (t + y linking)
"talk to" → /tɔːk tu/ (k + t linking)

speaker: Professor Martin
text: You’re doing great. Remember, learning to collaborate is just as important as the final product.
ipa: jʊr ˈduːɪŋ ɡreɪt. rɪˈmɛmbər, ˈlɜːrnɪŋ tu kəˈlæbəreɪt ɪz dʒəst æz ɪmˈpɔːrtənt æz ðə ˈfaɪnəl ˈprɒdʌkt.
stress: YOU’RE DOING GREAT. REMEMBER, LEARNING to COLLABORATE is JUST as IMPORTANT as the FINAL PRODUCT.
linking:
"learning to" → /ˈlɜːrnɪŋ tu/ (g + t linking)
"just as" → /dʒəst æz/ (t + a linking)
